Key Match Events: Dyson Daniels denied making a gun gesture after hitting a 3-pointer in front of the New Orleans Pelicans' bench during the Atlanta Hawks' 126-111 victory.
Dyson Daniels finished with 16 points in his return from a two-game absence due to a right hip strain.
Larry Nance Jr. scored 14 points and had notable interactions with the Pelicans' bench, including a third-quarter dunk and a corner 3-pointer.
A flagrant foul was called against Hawks guard Garrison Matthews for a hard forearm to the mid-section of Pelicans guard Jose Alvarado.
Post-Match Reflections: Dyson Daniels expressed that he was just having fun and wanted to let the Pelicans' bench know the 3-pointer was worth 3 points.
Larry Nance Jr. mentioned that the interactions with the Pelicans' bench were all in good spirit and that he has nothing but love and admiration for his former teammates.
Dyson Daniels reflected on his trade from New Orleans to Atlanta, stating it was unexpected but he is happy with his opportunity in Atlanta.
